text: Anyone who was worked with serverside tagging and the HubSpot tracking script. I’m wondering if and how it works with a HubSpot CMS website and a non-HS website with the tracking script. Worried that we might not be able to collect all data in HS.
The short answer is nope. I’ve faced the same problem
Can we use more than one extension in HubSpot project and how to configure that

Hello everyone, I am new here so sorry if this is the wrong room to ask in but I have a question about my domain configuration hoping someone can enlighten me.  We initially configured our domain with the A record provided by HubSpot but recently changed our configuration to use a reverse proxy (cloudfront).  Now that my dns records point at my reverse proxy, the HubSpot console is showing my domain as misconfigured and theres a button to reconfigured in the console.  is this expected behavior?  Will the domain records always show misconfigured in HubSpot when using a reverse proxy?
Which Slack channel do we use for custom UI card discussions?

Is it possible to insert a snippet of code in a module or something that would display the most recent edit/update date and time?

Ex: This page was last updated on July 1st, 2024 at 3:30pm.

Hey <@U071YF9HQF3> - sure :slightly_smiling_face:

```{{ content.updated }}```
you can use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#format-date|format_date> or <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#format-datetime|format_datetime> filter on this one like
```{{ content.updated|format_date('YYYY') }}```
